summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 8314, entitled "An Ordinance authorizing and directing the Board of Public Works to offer a reward of fifty (50) dollars to any person or persons furnishing evidence that will lead to the arrest and conviction of any party or parties that may be found depositing in the waters of the harbor in front of the City of Seattle, or the waters adjoining said harbor, the carcass or dead body of any horse, ox, cow, mule, jackass, hog, sheep, or other animal exceeding seventy-five (75) pounds in weight avoirdupois," approved July 9, 1902.
